favourite.article: This songs made me believes that there is heaven..and one day sure I will be there with God.
Thanks; this song always remains me to confess and repent and then run home to my Father.
Beautiful.
This song is blessing to me as it reminds me of Jesus love for me whenever I find myself lost in sin. Glory to God forever and ever.
Praise the Lord brother Roger Hsu! Welcome back home!!! May the Lord restore to you the lost years… Let's continue to enjoy Him!
After so many years Lord I'm coming home to Your Love! This is such a great blessing that You welcome us with open arms!

A few years back the Holy Spirit spoke to me and urged me to lead a group of distant prayer partners to worship and pray using this song to bring back to sanity a son of one of our members. By morning of the following day I was receiving a message that the boy had become as calm as a dove and since that time he has never gone back to his strange wayward ways. Join me in singing it to restore a daughter of a friend. She is married as a 3rd wife to an illiterate, abusive man. Her mother is so disturbed and has high blood pressure as a result. I will share the miracle with you. Thanks and be blessed.

This song touches my heart and moves me near and nearer to God. It reminds me of God's love unto me. It reminds me where God brought me from. Glory be to Almighty God who takes us the way we are and makes us more like Him.
This is one of the heavenly minded song...
When I look at my previous, I feel great redemption, oh Great, Great Lord my Saviour, I owe it to Thee.
I feel blessed when I hear this song. Lord, I am coming coz this world is sinful. Wash me in Your blood.
One of the great hymns of faith. This hymn has brought me through some very hard times. Thank You, God.

It's a great hymn of experience, only Christ can bring and accept us home. Thank You Lord for this moving song. We have wasted many years on things that do not satisfy, only Jesus can give what we need.
This song gives me joy, peace, hope and spiritual fullfiment. I give glory to the MOST HIGH GOD.

Born in Ireland, Kirkpatrick spent most of his life around the Philadelphia area where he served as music director in various Methodist churches. He is said to have compiled 100 gospel song books. -Songs of the Spirit by Martin Kirkpatrick wrote this song at a camp meeting in Rawlinsville, Pennsylvania, with a very specific purpose: to win the soul of his soloist, a nonbeliever. After Kirkpatrick prayed for the young man, these words came to him. He wrote them down quickly, and after the soloist sang them that night, he became a Christian.- Winning Songs by John J. Hood

Lord, I am broken wounded, I have sinned and shamed You. tired of sin and wayward ways..Please forgive me.. I do not know why You love me so.. I am grateful that Your grace and mercy surround us. If You will have me.. to come and life for You and close to You again my Savior and my Lord.
This song inspires me a lot. It makes me realize my mistake and come back to God.
Praise The Lord I'm coming home!
Indeed Jesus is the Lord our God, the creator of the universe and everything that happens to exist on earth and above, Glorious to His name forever and ever.

Yes ....I've wandered far away from home.....and now I am coming home....I need to be hugged by my Father God and feel His presence everyday of my life. Father, every sinful act I have done, fornicating, gossiping, preaching what I don't practice, enving, lying and many others...You have known my going out and my coming in, cleanse me by the blood of Jesus and sanctify me Daddy and make me pure and whole. Renew me and purify me oh God and make me worthy of Your kingdom. Wash me and make me as white as snow though my sins are as red as blood. Today I make a fresh start with You. Thank You for the Blood of Jesus. I ask all this in Jesus Name....Amen.

I broke down in tears when we sang this song in church at a closure of a presentation from our preacher of the day, I've wandered far away from God, my family and the world has swallowed me, please God forgive me and take me back.
The joy of our Father for we have been found when﻿ we were lost. That God for Your grace.
Most beautiful hymn, so reassuring and so forgiving that our Lord is there for us whatever we do in our life - waiting with open arms to welcome us home. Bless me Lord for I have sinned.

I love You Lord Jesus! I search for that perfect place to call home, where I feel at peace; But wherever You are is HOME. You're in my heart and I'm already home.
Thanks for the song.

What a joy to read these comments about our Lord, Who prepares us to crossover to eternal life. Everything else, including success and riches, is just a waste of time. Beautiful hymn focusing on "coming home."
My soul has been sick, my heart was sore, Now I'm coming home; Lord I glorify Your name.

This song is most fitting for the end of my presentation to the congregation on Sunday 28th... distractions, problems and self-importance influence us to stray - let us consider death and the judgement and hurry home....

O Lord, I know I have sinned against You, against my family. I strayed so far away from You. Now I know the error of my ways and I want to come back to You. Please forgive this unworthy sinner and hug me in Your arms and accept me back.
Thanks for preserving this heritage for posterity.
I love You Lord with all my heart. I am coming home.
I now repent with bitter tears, Lord I'm coming home... O wash me whiter than the snow, Lord. I'm coming home.
Oh my Lord, accept me. I'm coming home.
This hymn is one of the best in my life. It keeps me closer to the Lord always as I meditate its theme.
I was looking for a message to give to our congregation's Bible studies today and I remember this song. We are far from God and need going back to Him, especially me.
It is touchy. I've made my mind to go back home to my God like a prodigal son.
